alert.note: Alert for Cocke Smoky Mountains; Jefferson; North Sevier; Northwest Cocke; Northwest Greene; Sevier Smoky Mountains; Southeast Greene (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 8:21PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Jefferson, Cocke, southern Greene and east central Sevier Counties through 1000 PM EST... At 921 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of White Pine to 7 miles northeast of Gatlinburg. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Greeneville, Newport, Tusculum, Baneberry, Parrottsville, Pittman Center, Caney Branch, Del Rio, Cedar Creek and Bybee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Cocke Smoky Mountains; Jefferson; North Sevier; Northwest Cocke; Northwest Greene; Sevier Smoky Mountains; Southeast Greene
